english_translation: This is a fragmented hadith entry with incomplete chain and text. Narrated: Abu Bakr ibn Abi Shaybah narrated to us, from Wakee', from Said ibn al-Sa'ib, I heard a man from Bani Amir, one of Bani Suwa, called Abdullah ibn Muayya - mentioned the hadith at length.

narrators.name: Abu Bakr ibn Abi Shaybah
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Shaybah al-Kufi

chainIssues: Majhul narrator (Abdullah ibn Muayya) with limited information
Text incomplete - narrative ends with 'mentioned the hadith at length'

potential_issues.impact: The full text is not provided, only fragmentary information about the chain
Abdullah ibn Muayya is not well-known with limited biographical information
The hadith does not appear to have a complete chain to the Prophet ﷺ

english_translation: No text available - only companion name: Yazid ibn al-Aswad (may Allah be pleased with him)

chainIssues: Companion name only - appears to be index entry

potential_issues.impact: This appears to be a heading or index entry rather than a complete hadith
Cannot assess the reliability of transmission

english_translation: Narrated by Yazid ibn al-Aswad: I witnessed with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ his pilgrimage, so I prayed with him the dawn prayer in the mosque of al-Khayf. When he finished his prayer and turned away, behold he (saw) two men in the back of the people who had not prayed with him. So he said: bring them to me. They came to him trembling in their bodies. He said: What prevented you from praying with us? They said: O Messenger of Allah, we had already prayed in our tents. He said: Do not do that - when you have prayed in your tents, then come to a mosque where people gather and pray with them, for indeed it is a supererogatory prayer for you.

narrators.name: Abu Bakr ibn Abi Shaybah
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Shaybah al-Kufi
narrators.alternative_names: Ibn Abi Shaybah, Abu Bakr al-Kufi

narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

narrators.name: Khalid ibn Yusuf ibn Khalid
narrators.full_name: Khalid ibn Yusuf ibn Khalid al-Kufi

narrators.name: Jabir ibn Yazid
narrators.full_name: Jabir ibn Yazid ibn al-Aswad al-Amiri

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Second chain uses عَنْ (indirect term) by Abu Awanah from Ya'la ibn Ata', though Abu Awanah is reliable and this is likely direct transmission
Both chains converge at Ya'la ibn Ata' and Jabir ibn Yazid from his father

potential_issues.issue: Use of عَنْ in second chain
potential_issues.impact: Abu Awanah uses 'an with Ya'la ibn Ata', introducing slight ambiguity. However, both Abu Awanah and Ya'la ibn Ata' are reliable narrators, and this is a minor issue that does not significantly affect authenticity

potential_issues.issue: Khalid ibn Yusuf ibn Khalid has lower grade
potential_issues.impact: Graded as Saduq rather than Thiqah, which is slightly weaker than the first chain's Abu Bakr ibn Abi Shaybah

Topics: Incident of two men missing congregational prayer during the farewell pilgrimage
The Prophet ﷺ teaching about congregation prayer
Supererogatory prayer at home vs congregation prayer
Story of Yazid ibn al-Aswad's closeness to the Prophet ﷺ
Miraculous coolness and fragrance of the Prophet's ﷺ hand

english_translation: No text available - only companion name: Yazid ibn Amir al-Suwa'i (may Allah be pleased with him)

chainIssues: Companion name only - appears to be index entry

potential_issues.impact: This appears to be a heading or index entry rather than a complete hadith
Cannot assess the reliability of transmission

english_translation: Narrated by Yazid ibn Amir al-Suwa'i: And he had witnessed Hunain with the disbelievers, then he converted afterwards, and his conversion was good. So we asked him about the fear which Allah the Most High cast into the hearts of the disbelievers on the day of Hunain. How was it? He said: He would take for us a stone and throw it at a brass vessel (tast) and it would ring/resound. He said: So we would find in our chests something like this. And he said when the Muslims retreated on the day of Hunain and the disbelievers followed them, the Messenger of Allah ﷺ took a handful of earth, then turned with it towards the disbelievers, and threw it at their faces, and said: Return, shame be upon the faces. So there was not one of us who met his brother except he was complaining to him of the speck in his eye, and wiping his eye.

narrators.name: Al-Sa'ib ibn Yasar
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Sa'ib ibn Yasar al-Makki
narrators.alternative_names: Al-Sa'ib ibn Yasar, Abu Muhammad al-Makki

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

potential_issues.issue: Abu Mas'ud al-Razi and Musa ibn Mas'ud have lower reliability grades
potential_issues.impact: Both are graded as Saduq rather than Thiqah, which slightly reduces the overall chain strength. However, the rest of the chain consists of reliable narrators

potential_issues.issue: Yazid ibn Amir al-Suwa'i initially fought at Hunain with the disbelievers
potential_issues.impact: This enhances the credibility of his account as he witnessed the event firsthand from both sides, though his initial disbelief raises no reliability concerns about his hadith transmission

Topics: Incident of the Battle of Hunain - Divine fear cast into hearts of disbelievers
The Prophet's ﷺ method of striking terror into enemies by throwing dust
Yazid ibn Amir's conversion and his testimony to the miracle at Hunain
Eyewitness account of the supernatural fear that gripped the polytheists

chainIssues: Companion names only - appears to be index entry

potential_issues.impact: This appears to be a heading or index entry rather than a complete hadith
Cannot assess the reliability of transmission

english_translation: Narrated by Habah and Sawau, the two sons of Khalid: We entered upon the Messenger of Allah ﷺ while he was working on something, and we helped him with it. He said: Do not despair from provision as long as your heads move. Indeed, a person is born to his mother without skin, then Allah provides for him.

narrators.transmissionTermMeaning: From (direct transmission, acceptable despite being a mudallis of type 2)

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ

chainIssues: Al-A'mash is a mudallis of type 2 according to Ibn Hajar, but his use of عَنْ is generally acceptable as he is reliable

potential_issues.issue: Al-A'mash is classified as mudallis type 2
potential_issues.impact: Despite being a mudallis, Al-A'mash is highly reliable and his use of عَنْ does not significantly affect the hadith's authenticity. Type 2 mudallis practices are generally acceptable

Topics: Encouragement against hopelessness in seeking livelihood

english_translation: No text available - only companion name: Usamah ibn Sharik (may Allah be pleased with him)

chainIssues: Companion name only - appears to be index entry

potential_issues.impact: This appears to be a heading or index entry rather than a complete hadith
Cannot assess the reliability of transmission

english_translation: Narrated by Usamah ibn Sharik: I witnessed the Bedouins asking the Messenger of Allah ﷺ: Is there hardship upon us in such and such matters? He said: Servants of Allah, Allah the Mighty and Majestic has removed hardship except for the one who seizes something from his brother's honor - that is the one who brings hardship upon himself. Seek cure, servants of Allah, for indeed Allah the Mighty and Majestic has not placed a disease except that He placed with it a cure, except for old age. They said: O Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless you, what is the best thing given to a servant? He said: Good character.

narrators.name: Abu Bakr ibn Abi Shaybah
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Shaybah al-Kufi
narrators.alternative_names: Ibn Abi Shaybah, Abu Bakr al-Kufi

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

potential_issues.issue: None - strong chain with reliable narrators
potential_issues.impact: The chain is excellent with all narrators being well-known and reliable, particularly Sufyan ibn Uyaynah who is Thiqah Thabt

Topics: Divine mercy and removal of hardship
Islamic ethics and dealing with honor

english_translation: Narrated by Usamah ibn Sharik: The Bedouins said: O Messenger of Allah, what is the best thing given to a Muslim? He said: Good character.

narrators.name: Abu Bakr ibn Abi Shaybah

potential_issues.issue: Multiple paths in the chain - both Sufyan al-Thawri and Mis'ar report from Ziyad
potential_issues.impact: This strengthens the hadith as two reliable narrators (Sufyan and Mis'ar) independently report from the same source Ziyad ibn Ilaqah, providing additional confirmation

Topics: The Prophet's ﷺ teachings on virtuous traits

english_translation: Narrated by Usamah ibn Sharik: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ was asked about a man who shaved his head before slaughtering the sacrificial animal, and he said: There is no harm (in that). Additionally, I came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and his Companions were around him as if birds were sitting on their heads (due to the reverence and silence they observed).

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Razin al-Uqayli: The Prophet ﷺ said: The example of a believer is like the example of a bee. It eats only clean things and produces only clean things.

potential_issues.issue: Abu Salamah Yahya has Saduq grade
potential_issues.impact: While acceptable, the chain would be stronger if this narrator were Thiqah

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Razin al-Uqayli: The Prophet ﷺ said: A vision is one of forty-six parts of prophecy. A vision remains hanging by a bird's leg as long as one does not speak of it. When one speaks of it, it falls. Do not tell your vision except to a scholar, an advisor, or a beloved.

english_translation: Narrated: Between every two gates of Paradise is a distance of seventy years. In Paradise is a sea of water, a sea of wine, a sea of milk, and a sea of honey. Then rivers flow from these afterward.

english_translation: Narrated by Hakeem: He came to the Prophet ﷺ and asked: 'O Messenger of Allah, why did your Lord send you?' The Prophet ﷺ said: 'To worship Allah without associating anything with Him, to establish prayer, to give zakah, and every Muslim is forbidden to another Muslim. O Hakeem, this is your religion wherever you are - it will suffice you.'

potential_issues.impact: Chain weakened by multiple narrators with Saduq grade but still acceptable

Topics: Core message of the Prophet ﷺ

english_translation: Narrated by Malik al-Qushayri: The Prophet ﷺ said: Whoever frees a Muslim slave, Allah will free every bone of his body from the Fire in exchange for every bone of the freed person. And whoever finds one of his parents alive and does not gain their forgiveness - may Allah keep him far from His mercy. And whoever takes care of an orphan among his Muslim relatives in his food and drink until Allah enriches him - Paradise becomes obligatory for him.

potential_issues.impact: Strengthens the hadith with dual transmission
